intro: Endammia, commonly known as the false arrowhead, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. The plants typically have heart-shaped leaves and produce showy, often yellow or white, flowers. They are often found in wet or swampy areas, thriving in humid environments. Endammia species are sometimes cultivated for their ornamental value due to their attractive foliage and blooms.
